it.polimi.se2019.client.cli

Class CLIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.client.cli.CLIController

  • public class CLIController
extends java.lang.Object
    The CLI controller is used to print the complex elements of the interface, in particular the map, the boards, the powerups and the weapons etc
    Author:
    FF

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CLIController() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handleCharactersLoading()
      This loads all the players and myself.
      void handleMapLoading()
      This method prints the map and the killshot bar, the map is printed using a trick, the maps a saved as text files and the sections where crates and players can spawn are marked to be replaced by the actual content.
      void handlePlayerBoard(Player p)
      This prints a player board, its a complex part and uses a lot of utf8 special chars
      java.lang.String handlePowerUp(PowerUp c)
      This just prints a single powerup
      java.lang.String handlePowerUps(java.util.List<PowerUp> powerUps)
      This uses a mechanism to print the powerups in a 2 columns pattern.
      java.lang.String handleWeapon(Weapon c)
      This just prints a single weapon
      java.lang.String handleWeapons(java.util.List<Weapon> weapons)
      This uses a mechanism to print the weapons in a 3 columns pattern.
      void setView(CLIView view)
      This is a view setter

    • Constructor Detail

      • CLIController

        public CLIController()

    • Method Detail

      • handleMapLoading

        public void handleMapLoading()
        This method prints the map and the killshot bar, the map is printed using a trick, the maps a saved as text files and the sections where crates and players can spawn are marked to be replaced by the actual content. This allow the code to be very streamlined.

      • handleCharactersLoading

        public void handleCharactersLoading()
        This loads all the players and myself. It loads the board and their unloaded weapons. For my self it also prints my powerups.

      • handlePlayerBoard

        public void handlePlayerBoard(Player p)
        This prints a player board, its a complex part and uses a lot of utf8 special chars
        Parameters:
        p - the player to print the board

      • handleWeapons

        public java.lang.String handleWeapons(java.util.List<Weapon> weapons)
        This uses a mechanism to print the weapons in a 3 columns pattern. It uses scanners to work.
        Parameters:
        weapons - the weapons list
        Returns:
        the string to be printed

      • handlePowerUps

        public java.lang.String handlePowerUps(java.util.List<PowerUp> powerUps)
        This uses a mechanism to print the powerups in a 2 columns pattern. It uses scanners to work.
        Parameters:
        powerUps - the powerups list
        Returns:
        the string to be printed

      • handlePowerUp

        public java.lang.String handlePowerUp(PowerUp c)
        This just prints a single powerup
        Parameters:
        c - the powerup
        Returns:
        the string to be printed

      • handleWeapon

        public java.lang.String handleWeapon(Weapon c)
        This just prints a single weapon
        Parameters:
        c - the weapon
        Returns:
        the string to be printed

      • setView

        public void setView(CLIView view)
        This is a view setter
        Parameters:
        view - the view
